title: it should go from Santa Monica to Inyo County and thence to Salt Lake. The road reached Los Angeles. The year 1869 marked the driving of the last spike on the transcontinental railroad, the Union Pacific. The Texas & Pacific Railroad was surveying a route into San Diego. The Atlantic & Pacific Railroad was considering a link from Santa Barbara to San Francisco. None of the plans included Los Angeles. The problems connected with the locations of the railroads were to engage the attention of a number of men who served the city as city attorney
